verses.kjv: By night on my bed I sought him whom my soul loveth: I sought him, but I found him not.
verses.ct: At night in my bed, I searched for the one my soul loves. I searched for him but couldn't find him.

verses.kjv: I will rise now, and go about the city in the streets, and in the broad ways I will seek him whom my soul loveth: I sought him, but I found him not.
verses.ct: "I'll get up now and wander through the city — through the streets and the open squares — looking for the one my soul loves." I searched for him but couldn't find him.

verses.kjv: The watchmen that go about the city found me: to whom I said, Saw ye him whom my soul loveth?
verses.ct: The guards patrolling the city came across me. I asked them, "Have you seen the one my soul loves?"

verses.kjv: It was but a little that I passed from them, but I found him whom my soul loveth: I held him, and would not let him go, until I had brought him into my mother’s house, and into the chamber of her that conceived me.
verses.ct: I had barely passed them when I found the one my soul loves. I grabbed hold of him and refused to let go until I had brought him to my mother's house, into the room of the woman who gave me life.

verses.kjv: I charge you, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, by the roes, and by the hinds of the field, that ye stir not up, nor awake my love, till he please.
verses.ct: I urge you, daughters of Jerusalem, by the gazelles and the wild deer: don't stir up or awaken love until the right time.

verses.kjv: Who is this that cometh out of the wilderness like pillars of smoke, perfumed with myrrh and frankincense, with all powders of the merchant?
verses.ct: What is this coming up from the wilderness like columns of smoke, fragrant with myrrh and frankincense, with every fine spice a trader could offer?

verses.kjv: Behold his bed, which is Solomon’s; threescore valiant men are about it, of the valiant of Israel.
verses.ct: Look — it's Solomon's traveling bed! 60 mighty warriors surround it, the finest soldiers in Israel.

verses.kjv: They all hold swords, being expert in war: every man hath his sword upon his thigh because of fear in the night.
verses.ct: Every one of them carries a sword and is trained for battle. Each man has his sword strapped to his side, ready for any danger in the night.

verses.kjv: King Solomon made himself a chariot of the wood of Lebanon.
verses.ct: King Solomon had a royal carriage built for himself from the wood of Lebanon.

verses.kjv: He made the pillars thereof of silver, the bottom thereof of gold, the covering of it of purple, the midst thereof being paved with love, for the daughters of Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Its posts were crafted from silver, its base from gold, its seat covered in purple fabric, and its interior was lovingly decorated by the daughters of Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: Go forth, O ye daughters of Zion, and behold king Solomon with the crown wherewith his mother crowned him in the day of his espousals, and in the day of the gladness of his heart.
verses.ct: Come out, daughters of Zion, and gaze at King Solomon wearing the crown his mother placed on his head on his wedding day — the day his heart was filled with joy.
